snippet: The Italian Coast Guard said the cargo ship, carrying about 450 migrants, was being towed toward the southeastern coast after running out of fuel.
abstract: Italian authorities race to rescue hundreds of migrants from aging freighter that traffickers had pointed toward Italy, left on autopilot and then abandoned; episode is confirmation that traffickers have hit on new tactic for greater profits and ability to elude authorities.

byline.original: By ELISABETTA POVOLEDO and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Elisabetta Povoledo reported from Verbania, and Alan Cowell from London.

lead_paragraph: The Italian Coast Guard said the cargo ship, carrying about 450 migrants, was being towed toward the southeastern coast after running out of fuel.

headline.main: Traffickers Set Freighter on a Course for Italy and Flee, Leaving Migrants Aboard
headline.print_headline: Traffickers Set Freighter on a Course for Italy and Flee, Leaving Migrants Aboard
